comments.text:
Not quite. It prints in ABS plastic (yes, that's the kind made from crude 
oil, which is why it has the smell,) and it was supposed to allow for 
people to draw things in 3d. Fundamentally, it works like a 3d printer, but 
it's mostly just an experimental product at this point. Hopefully, the 
people who build these devices will gradually improve on them, and in a few 
years they'll have on that actually works, because it's really difficult to 
get such a small extruder to heat the plastic to the perfect temperature.

+Hank Hill you cannot compare specs of an Apple device to an Android OS 
device. iOS uses optimization, thus the hardware works extremely well with 
the software. 

Also they cost a lot because the materials used are top-notch. The cameras 
in Apple products are high-end, the screens, while not 5K 900 PPI, are very 
vibrant and accurate, they have great build quality, technology like Touch 
ID, 64-Bit architecture, smooth UI, etc.

I'm no Apple fanboy, its just kinda common knowledge that the highest end 
Apple phone will be better than a high end Android, since Android is open 
source, not allowing the the OS to take advantage of the hardware.
